statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Elon 70, Wofford 67
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. (AP) -- T.J. Douglas hit a 3-pointer with 3.9 seconds left in overtime to lead Elon to a 70-67 win over Wofford on Saturday night. The Phoenix (8-15, 6-9 Southern Conference) needed a 3 from Brian Waters at the regulation buzzer to send the game into an extra period. The referees conferred for a few minutes before ruling the shot came from behind the arc. Elon took the lead for good with 38 seconds left in overtime when Brett James hit a 3-pointer to take a 67-65 lead. The Terriers (14-10, 7-7) tied the game with two free throws by Drew Gibson with 26 seconds left, setting up Douglas' winning shot. Wofford had a chance to tie, but Shane Nichols missed a 3-pointer at the buzzer. The Terriers gave up a four-point lead in the final 10 seconds of regulation. Adam Constantine hit a jumper for Elon and Nichols made just one of two free throws before Walters made his tying 3. James led all scorers with 25 points, making all five of his 3-pointers, while Constantine and Douglas each added 11 for Elon, who broke a six-game losing streak. Nichols and Junior Salters each scored 14 points to lead Wofford, while Gibson added 12 points and 10 assists.
